alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Macomb; Oakland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 6:40PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...SCATTERED HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS MOVE THROUGH LIVINGSTON... OAKLAND...AND COUNTIES LATE IN THE EVENING COMMUTE... HAZARDS...Areas of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. Temperatures at or below freezing also allow accumulation on untreated roads. A quick inch of accumulation on unpaved surfaces. The larger area of activity extends west of Lansing resulting in a 1 to 2 hour period of intermittent heavy snow bursts in any one location. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 637 PM EST, areas of heavy snow were along a line from near Fenton to near Hartland to Whitmore Lake and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Milford and Ortonville around 650 PM EST. Livonia, Novi and Oxford around 705 PM EST. Pontiac and West Bloomfield around 710 PM EST. Birmingham, Rochester and Detroit Zoo around 720 PM EST. Southfield and Royal Oak around 725 PM EST. Warren, Troy and Romeo around 730 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 60 and 105. I-96 between mile markers 125 and 167. I-696 between mile markers 1 and 28. M-59 between mile markers 38 and 49. US-23 between mile markers 53 and 77. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution when traveling into or through areas of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
